head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Sunday, April 12, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Sunday, April 12, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, Happy Easter to all who celebrate! I'm saddenned that so many families and church communities weren't able to gather today as they normally would. Whether you observed via live-streaming, Zoom, or some non-electronic means, I hope the day was filled with light, love, and a sense of rebirth. In that vein, I offer the final lines of Maya Angelou's famous poem, On the Pulse of Morning. Lift up your eyes upon This day breaking for you. Give birth again To the dream. Women, children, men, Take it into the palms of your hands. Mold it into the shape of your most Private need. Sculpt it into The image of your most public self. Lift up your hearts Each new hour holds new chances For new beginnings. Do not be wedded forever To fear, yoked eternally To brutishness. The horizon leans forward, Offering you space to place new steps of change. Here, on the pulse of this fine day You may have the courage To look up and out and upon me, the Rock, the River, the Tree, your country. No less to Midas than the mendicant. No less to you
meta.name: description

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Sunday, April 12, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, Happy Easter to all who celebrate! I'm saddenned that so many families and church communities weren't able to gather today as they normally would. Whether you observed via live-streaming, Zoom, or some non-electronic means, I hope the day was filled with light, love, and a sense of rebirth. In that vein, I offer the final lines of Maya Angelou's famous poem, On the Pulse of Morning. Lift up your eyes upon This day breaking for you. Give birth again To the dream. Women, children, men, Take it into the palms of your hands. Mold it into the shape of your most Private need. Sculpt it into The image of your most public self. Lift up your hearts Each new hour holds new chances For new beginnings. Do not be wedded forever To fear, yoked eternally To brutishness. The horizon leans forward, Offering you space to place new steps of change. Here, on the pulse of this fine day You may have the courage To look up and out and upon me, the Rock, the River, the Tree, your country. No less to Midas than the mendicant. No less to you

div.span: Happy Easter to all who celebrate! I'm saddenned that so many families and church communities weren't able to gather today as they normally would. Whether you observed via live-streaming, Zoom, or some non-electronic means, I hope the day was filled with light, love, and a sense of rebirth. In that vein, I offer the final lines of Maya Angelou's famous poem, "On the Pulse of Morning."

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;margin-left: 20px

The horizon leans forward,
Offering you space to place new steps of change.
Here, on the pulse of this fine day

To look up and out and upon me, the
Rock, the River, the Tree, your country.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;margin-left: 20px

em.span: No less to you now than the mastodon then.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;margin-left: 20px

em.span:
Here on the pulse of this new day
You may have the grace to look up and out
And into your sister's eyes, and into
Your brother's face, your country
And say simply
Very simply
With hope
Good morning.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: The Warrior Community would like to send a major shout out to Ms. Mikessha Robinson, Family & Consumer Science Teacher, at Henderson Middle School! Mrs. Robinson put together a DIY video for her YouTube page, walking our Warrior Families through the process of how to create face masks in the event that they need to travel from their homes during this time of social distancing. Thank you, Ms. Robinson, for showing such initiative and showing our families how much we care about them!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Huge Shout out to Mrs. Chelsea Harvey, Science Exceptional Education teacher at Henderson Middle School. Mrs. Harvey has been doing an incredible job of reaching out to students on her caseload. Ms. Harvey sent home letters to students and families, sharing online resources to use during the time away from school, but also reminding students of how much they are missed.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I wanted to give a shoutout to my mentor, Ms. Hardy, from Oak Grove Bellemeade. Since we have closed, she has checked on me daily and has been providing me with continuous support. Also, today is her birthday!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shouting out Headstart Teachers, Ms. Moore and Ms. Payne, from Oak Grove Bellemeade!!! My daughter turned four on April 1st. Because she wasn’t able to have a party, I did a birthday parade and both of her teachers showed up and had their cars decorated. They stopped, gave air kisses, and sent their love. They’re the best. It made her day. She was so excited to see them!!!! Ms. Moore and Ms. Payne are awesome teachers!!!!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a shout out to Mrs. Ashley Morgan, first grade teacher at William Fox. It is a pleasure to see the weekly Zoom meetings with her class. My child was so excited to see his teacher and classmates. I could not have had a better teacher!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to thank Ms. Harvey at Henderson Middle School. She is my son's teacher. She calls and checks in on him to see how he's doing. I love that she's concerned about his well-being. I'm glad to have a teacher in my son's corner that loves and cares about him as much as I do. Thanks, Ms. Harvey, for all that you do!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Ms. Cates, 3rd grade teacher at Fox, has gone above and beyond to keep her students learning! Her online lessons are great, and she has made every effort to help take some of the burden off her kids and their families!
